Posts.Content: Having read your intial lead and all the following advice and suport.  I am humbled to be a part of this webstie. It also mades me sad as well as angry, that organisations eg mortgage lenders can be so heartless.  You have enough already on your plate to deal with without the mortgage people bitting at your heels. Where is the compassion these days?  Keep you chin up girl and go for it.
Posts.Title: borrowing money

Posts.Content: Hi Nightingale   I had a lumpectomy carried out in March this year.  And am still experiencing sharp pains (like a needle jabbing you in the breast) which you mentioned above and also still have a lump in the breast.    I have been advised by the community nurse on this website to go and see the GP.  As I am also waiting for a follow up appointment which still has not materlised.    I thought because they acted really quick everything was hunky dorey but now I am feeling a bit worried and anxious.   torchwood
Posts.Title: Ductal Lumpectomy and pulsating nerve pain?
